revisionDesc.tei:change: Added references to local authority file (/BachUni/BachBibliothek/GitHub/OpenArabicPE/authority-files/data/tei/personography_OpenArabicPE.TEIP5.xml) and VIAF to persNames without such references based on persons in the local authority file. If the source persName did not contain any further TEI mark-up, this has been added from the local authority file.

Added references to local authority file (/BachUni/BachBibliothek/GitHub/OpenArabicPE/authority-files/data/tei/bibliography_OpenArabicPE-periodicals.TEIP5.xml) and to OCLC (WorldCat) IDs to titless without such references based on biblStructs mentioned in the authority file (bibliography).
revisionDesc.change: Added references to local authority file (/BachUni/BachBibliothek/GitHub/OpenArabicPE/authority-files/data/tei/gazetteer_OpenArabicPE.TEIP5.xml) and to GeoNames IDs to placeNames without such references based on places mentioned in the authority file.

Added references to local authority file (/BachUni/BachBibliothek/GitHub/OpenArabicPE/authority-files/data/tei/gazetteer_OpenArabicPE.TEIP5.xml) and to GeoNames IDs to placeNames without such references based on places mentioned in the authority file.
revisionDesc.tei:change: Added references to local authority file (/BachUni/BachBibliothek/GitHub/OpenArabicPE/authority-files/data/tei/bibliography_OpenArabicPE-periodicals.TEIP5.xml) and to OCLC (WorldCat) IDs to titless without such references based on biblStructs mentioned in the authority file (bibliography).
revisionDesc.change: Converted tabular bibliographic data to lists of biblStruct.

biblStruct.note: official paper. Arabic and French, replaced by Ḥadīqat al-Akhbār

item.rs: HTU: 1310 (it is vol 11th, only Ottoman Turkish)

biblStruct.note: There are long (kabīr) and short (ṣaghīr) versions for Volumes 6 to 9, which were most likely targetted at two different markets (the long version at Egypt and Europe and the short one at Beirut, Lebanon, and surrounding areas). Volume 4 exhibits similar characteristics but is unmarked beyond the pricing.
Ṭ dated it 1880 wrongly, an issue (5 January 1882) in DKQM states that it is the journal's sixth year
there is also one in 1882 and 1883 with Amīn Nāṣif (but not to be confused with a later Mirʾāt al-Sharq 1919-1939)
under this name appeared in 1879 by Amīn Nāṣif

list.item: Ṭ= 6 March 1886, Hartmann= 10 October 1885 (but it must be 1 Muḥarram 1303)

ه م عقربي / محمد عبد الرحمن الصنادلي

biblStruct.note: bi-lingual paper (Arabic and Portuguese) by a Syrian homme des lettres in São Paolo

OpenArabicPE: Digital full-text edition (without Riḍā's tafsīr) ,

biblStruct.note: the third journal in this name, but likely no connection
The first 12 issues carried the title al-Jāmiʿa al-ʿUthmāniyya
Ismail Ghasparinski, Ṭ: journal existed only for two months

list.item: MJU: 1909-10 (at least). Available online from Internet Archive: 1909, 1910.

biblStruct.note: This is the newspaper al-Muqtabas. Not to be confused with the journal of the same name.

list.item: Ṭ corrected based on vol.1, n.1

biblStruct.note: This daily newspaper was short-lived and is not to be confused with al-Qabas published by Shukrī al-ʿAsalī and Muḥammad Kurd ʿAlī between 1913 and 1914.
Lisān al-ʿArab continued the publication of Ṣadā al-Mufīd when the latter was banned from publication. Lisān al-ʿArab was banned from publication after only 5 days.
al-Qabas was a replacement for Kurd ʿAlī's newspaper al-Muqtabas during the latter's ban from publication. Issue numbers reflected this fact.

list.item: PN: year 1 no. 17 (18 December 1914); year 2 nos 18-19 (1 January - 29 January 1915); year 2 no. 22 (15 April 1915)

biblStruct.note: Ṭ: after the war, al-Ghurayyib returned to Lebanon and published al-Shams in Beirut

Ṭ's data is corrected based on first issue

al-Zahra continued from Zahrat al-Jamīl and continued as al-Zuhūr
